facts: An itinerary is a planned schedule of your trip that lists where you will go and when.
A layover is a stop between flights where you may change planes or wait before continuing your journey.
A boarding pass is the ticket-like document you show to enter an airplane, train, or bus for your trip.
Customs is the place where officials check people and goods entering a country to make sure rules are followed.
A passport is an official government ID that you usually need to travel to other countries.
Baggage claim is the area at an airport where you pick up your checked luggage after your flight lands.
A round-trip ticket lets you travel to a destination and then return to your starting point using the same booking.
sources_hint: Verify definitions with a student dictionary or travel glossary from major airlines, airports, or government travel sites.
